movies.title: Phantom - The Animation
movies.plot: Zwei was an ordinary person, until one day, while walking the streets a night, he witnessed a brutal assassination. He managed to avoid the sniper, a young girl named Ein, but was soon captured, and had the memories of his former life erased. He is spared death only by accepting a condition : to train to become an assassin alongside Ein. Now he must find a way to free himself from this shady world and reclaim his life once again.
movies.simplePlot: Zwei was an ordinary person, until one day, while walking the streets a night, he witnessed a brutal assassination. He managed to avoid the sniper, a young girl named Ein, but was soon ...

biography.bio: Doug Erholtz was born on February 21, 1971 as Douglas J. Erholtz. He is known for his work on Digimon: Digital Monsters (1999), Patlabor: The Movie (1989) and Patlabor 2: The Movie (1993).
biography.name: Doug Erholtz

biography.bio: Shô Hayami was born on August 2, 1958 in Takasago, Hyogo, Japan as Yasushi Ôhama. He is an actor, known for Super Dimension Century Orguss (1983), Macross Plus (1994) and Lain (1998). He is married to Rei Igarashi.
biography.name: Shô Hayami

biography.placeOfBirth: New York City, New York, USA
biography.bio: Megan Hollingshead was born on September 22, 1968 in New York City, New York, USA as Megan T.D. Hollingshead. She is known for her work on Pokémon (1997), Pokémon: The First Movie - Mewtwo Strikes Back (1998) and The Last of Us (2013).
biography.name: Megan Hollingshead

biography.bio: Kikuko Inoue was born on September 25, 1964 in Yokosuka, Japan. She is an actress, known for Kiki's Delivery Service (1989), Oh My Goddess! (1993) and Kaitou Saint Tail (1995).
biography.name: Kikuko Inoue

biography.bio: Mela Lee was born on July 31, 1976. She is known for her work on Fate/stay night: Unlimited Blade Works (2014), Miraculous: Tales of Ladybug & Cat Noir (2015) and Independence Day: Resurgence (2016).
biography.name: Mela Lee

biography.bio: After a successful 12-year run as a radio personality in the Midwest and New York City, Dave moved to Los Angeles in 1984 to pursue a career in voice acting that has included commercials, film dubbing, looping, narration and voice characterization in countless cartoons. Dave provided the daily intros and voice of Baboo in Mighty Morphin Power Rangers (1993) for Saban Productions and in 2007, was nominated for both Best Actor and Best Actor in a Comedy for the 1st Annual American Anime Awards held in New York City.
biography.name: Dave Mallow

biography.bio: Michael McConnohie was born on July 23, 1951 in Mansfield, Ohio, USA as Michael D. McConnohie. He is an actor and writer, known for Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1990), Akira (1988) and Resident Evil: Degeneration (2008).
biography.name: Michael McConnohie

biography.bio: Omi Minami was born on July 13, 1968 in Tokyo, Japan. She is an actress, known for Origine (2006), Gintama (2006) and Hand Maid May (2001).
biography.name: Omi Minami

biography.bio: Kazuhiro Nakata was born on March 19, 1958 in Nagasaki, Japan as Kazuhiro Nakada. He is an actor, known for Shadow of the Colossus (2005), .hack//SIGN (2002) and Rurouni Kenshin: Wandering Samurai (1996).
biography.name: Kazuhiro Nakata

biography.bio: Ai Orikasa was born on December 12, 1963 in Tokyo, Japan as Kikue Orikasa. She is an actress, known for Tenchi Muyô! (1992), Zyuden Sentai Kyoryuger (2013) and Tenchi the Movie 2: The Daughter of Darkness (1997).
biography.name: Ai Orikasa

biography.bio: Cindy Robinson began her career as a stage actress. In New York she played leading roles in multiple shows on Broadway including Stephen Sondheim's "Into The Woods," "Peter Pan" and the Tony Award winning production of "Carousel" at Lincoln Center. When Cindy moved to Hollywood she used her talents to bring animated characters to life. Her voice can be heard on "Tutenstein," "Scooby and Shaggy," as Snow White's Evil Stepmother in "Happily N'Ever After 2," as Lois Lane and Brainiac for DC Comics "Superman: Red Son Rising" Pepper Potts in Marvel's "Iron Man" and Mary Jane Watson in "Ultimate Spider-Man" as well as multiple voices in Mattel's "Polly Pocket" and "Monster High." She was also the voice of Leap in the very successful LeapFrog DVD franchise. Notable video game appearances include "BioShock 2", "Fallout: New Vegas," "Biohazard: Degeneration," "Sonic Free Riders" and "Mass Effect 2" to name a few and she can also be heard in over 100 feature films and television shows such as "Entourage," "Californication," "The Good Wife," "Crazy Heart," "The Fighter" and NBC's "Community." And most notably, Cindy is the official voice of Betty Boop.
biography.name: Cindy Robinson

biography.bio: Takahiro Sakurai was born on June 13, 1974 in Okazaki, Japan. He is an actor, known for Final Fantasy VII: Advent Children (2005), Polar Bear's Café (2012) and D.Gray-man (2006).
biography.name: Takahiro Sakurai

biography.bio: Keith Silverstein was born on December 24, 1970 in Plainfield, New Jersey, USA. He is known for his work on The Spectacular Now (2013), Ice Age: Continental Drift (2012) and Resident Evil: Degeneration (2008).
biography.name: Keith Silverstein

biography.bio: Steve Staley was born on August 25, 1969 in Denver, Colorado, USA as Steven Staley. He is known for his work on Kidô senshi Gundam: Dai 08 MS shôtai (1996), Digimon: Digital Monsters (1999) and Les chevaliers magiques du clair de terre (1994).
biography.name: Steve Staley

biography.bio: Kirk Thornton was born on May 13, 1956 in Portland, Oregon, USA. He is known for his work on Digimon: Digital Monsters (1999), Ninja Scroll (1993) and Akira (1988). He is married to Julie Nesbitt. They have two children.
biography.name: Kirk Thornton
